intro: Bulbinella triquetra, commonly known as the three-lobed rock lily, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae, commonly known as the orchid family. This perennial herb is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. The plant grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in coastal or inland regions. Its unique three-lobed leaves and compact growth habit make it a distinctive and attractive addition to native gardens.
